str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Gall, bitter herbs. Feminine of an equivalent perhaps akin to the same as Chloe; 'gall' or bile, i.e. poison or an anodyne.
Bitterness, harshness, hence met: an embittered (resentful) spirit. From pikros; acridity, literally or figuratively.
That which binds together; a band, bond. From sun and desmon; a joint tie, i.e. Ligament, uniting principle, control.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
